alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 11:45AM PDT until September 09 at 4:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 343 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 343 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Desert Slopes and Agua Caliente is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Borrego Springs, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Julian, Mount Laguna, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line and southeastern Anza. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
